meanings.definition: The presence of an abnormal closure or blockage of a passage in the body, such as a blood vessel or the intestines.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient with atresias in the intestines.
meanings.sent2: Atresias can cause serious health issues if not treated promptly.
meanings.sent3: The atresias in the blood vessel decided to take a vacation, causing a traffic jam in the body.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was like atresias, blocking any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The atresias in the intestines were like a closed door, preventing anything from passing through.

meanings.definition: The condition of having a congenital absence or closure of a normal body opening, such as the ear canal or the esophagus.
meanings.sent1: The baby was born with atresias in the ear canal, requiring immediate medical attention.
meanings.sent2: Atresias in the esophagus can make swallowing difficult for some individuals.
meanings.sent3: The atresias in the ear canal whispered secrets to each other, causing hearing problems.
meanings.sent4: His closed-mindedness was like atresias, shutting out any new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The atresias in the esophagus were like a closed gate, blocking the passage of food.
